summary: The Safeguarding Charity Act (H.R. 2896) amends Title 1 of the United States Code to clarify that tax exemptions for certain non-profit organizations (described in section 501(c), 501(d), and 401(a) of the Internal Revenue Code) do not constitute "Federal financial assistance." The bill specifies that this clarification applies unless explicitly stated otherwise by other federal laws, and it includes a rule of construction regarding the historical perspective of the tax exemption as government assistance.
